title: Neuropsychologist
description: Studies how brain function affects behavior and cognition.
responsibilities: Assess and treat brain injuries, conduct cognitive testing, collaborate with medical teams.
licensure: State licensure as a psychologist + postdoctoral training in neuropsychology

title: Engineering Psychologist
description: Enhances technology and product design by studying human interaction with systems.
responsibilities: Optimize human-system interaction, conduct usability testing, improve safety and efficiency.
education: Master's or Ph.D. in Psychology or Human Factors

title: Industrial-Organizational Psychologist
description: Industrial-organizational psychologists use psychological principles to improve workplace productivity, employee morale, and organizational effectiveness.
responsibilities: Improve workplace outcomes through assessments, employee training, and organizational strategy development.
education: Master's degree typically required; doctorate preferred for advanced roles or certification
licensure: Licensure may be required depending on state regulations

title: Clinical and Counseling Psychologist
description: Provide mental health care by diagnosing and treating emotional, behavioral, and psychological disorders through therapy and intervention strategies.
responsibilities: Diagnose and treat mental health disorders using psychological assessments and therapy, sometimes collaborating with medical professionals.

title: Forensic Psychologist
description: Apply psychology within the legal and criminal justice system, assisting with criminal profiling, competency evaluations, and expert testimony.
responsibilities: Conduct evaluations, provide expert testimony, and support legal professionals with psychological insights.
licensure: Licensure required to practice independently; legal training optional but beneficial

title: Substance Abuse Counselor
description: Help individuals recover from drug, alcohol, and behavioral addictions by providing therapeutic support and guidance through recovery programs.
responsibilities: Assess clients, guide them through recovery plans, and support behavior change through counseling and therapy.
education: At least a bachelor's degree; master's preferred for clinical roles
licensure: Licensure typically required for independent practice

title: Sport Psychologist
description: Support athletes by improving their mental well-being and performance through psychological strategies and therapy.
responsibilities: Help athletes manage stress, recover from injuries, and improve focus and motivation through mental training.
education: Master's or doctoral degree in psychology or related fields (e.g., counseling, sports science)

title: Military Psychologist
description: Serve military personnel and veterans by conducting evaluations, providing therapy, and supporting mental health and performance under high-stress conditions.
responsibilities: Evaluate service members' mental health, provide therapy, and support deployment readiness and crisis response.
licensure: Licensure required; may serve as enlisted officer

title: Psychiatrist
description: As medical doctors, psychiatrists diagnose mental health conditions and provide treatment plans, including medication management.
responsibilities: Diagnose mental illnesses, prescribe medications, and oversee treatment plans in collaboration with other mental health professionals.
education: Medical degree (M.D. or D.O.) with a residency in psychiatry
licensure: Medical license and board certification in psychiatry required
